qas.question: The Hudson River serves as a dividing line between New York and what state?
What river flows between the Hudson and East Rivers?
What is the city's sole fresh water river?
Into what body of water does the Hudson River terminate?
Between New York City and what city is the Hudson River an estuary?
The Hudson River separates NYC from which US state?
The single only freshwater river in NYC is what river?
Which river seperates The Bronx from Manhatten?

context: The Hudson River flows through the Hudson Valley into <a3_0>New York Bay<a3_0/>. Between New York City and <a4_0>Troy, New York<a4_0/>, the river is an estuary. The Hudson River separates the city from the U.S. state of <a0_0><a5_0>New Jersey<a5_0/><a0_0/>. The East River—a tidal strait—flows from Long Island Sound and separates the Bronx and Manhattan from Long Island. <a7_0>The <a1_0>Harlem River<a7_0/><a1_0/>, another tidal strait between the East and Hudson Rivers, separates most of Manhattan from the Bronx. <a6_0>The <a2_0>Bronx River<a6_0/><a2_0/>, which flows through the Bronx and Westchester County, is the only entirely fresh water river in the city.
